name: Ambassador Hotel Downtown Kansas City

reviews.text: The decor is fabulous in this renovated downtown gem! I was there in February 2013 on business, and was truly impressed with the style of this hotel. GIGANTIC granite shower..big fluffy bed...ahhh! Bliss!
reviews.title: 95% Wonderful!

reviews.text: My only complaint was the restaurant....which is my reason for the 95% rating. I was terribly un-impressed with the food. For breakfast, I had ordered poached eggs. My eggs were so runny, I literally had to eat them with a spoon. Blech...
reviews.title: Outstanding Customer Service!

reviews.text: I was in KC for 6 days on business. First impressions speak volumes, and the hotel was not only adorable but the staff was outstanding! I love a cute hotel, but the staff brought this hotel to an amazing level. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience EVER!

reviews.text: I was in Kansas City for 6 days last week for business. I was blown away by my entire experience at the Ambassador; from the decor to the cleanliness, the comfort of the rooms, the food, the atmosphere, and particularly the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Everyone from the receptionist to the bar tender to the cook and the GM...hands down THE BEST!!!! I had a regular room for two nights, (which was great)! The rest of the time I was in a suite that I hosted meetings in. It was wonderful. I also hosted meetings in the board room. They helped me set up, brought me what ever I asked for, etc... I would not recommend staying anywhere else in Kansas City Downtown Area because you'd be missing out!!!! Great job, Ambassador!!! You get 5 stars from me!!!
reviews.title: Great Spot in Town

reviews.text: A nice little boutique hotel. Well appointed. Clean. Great bed. Parking available. Close to venues. The bar and lobby area are very nice. Easy to get in and out of if you have a car. Would choose it again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Good Area for various activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are large and luxurious. We were only in town for the night, and regret that we were not able to stay there longer! The shower was absolutely huge as well.
reviews.title: Plush, Luxurious, and Reasonably Priced.

reviews.text: We managed to score a bed and breakfast package at $184 per night which included parking, however I think the parking would have been $15 a day without it.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in KC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was generous, with a selection of teas/juices and coffee, and an a la carte menu.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem in Downtown KC

reviews.text: The only reason that I wouldn't give this place 100% review, is that after arriving, it took about 20min waiting at the bar for a barman to come and get our order. Apart from that, it was fantastic!
reviews.title: Fabulous Boutique Hotel At A Great Price!

reviews.text: This is a great hotel. Great location only a few blocks from Power and Light district. Wonderful personal service. A car will take you anywhere in the area like the Plaza. Great food and a cool bar. The rooms are very nice.
reviews.title: Girls retreat-fantastic time

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week on a work trip.
reviews.title: Up and down experience

reviews.text: Pros - The hotel and atmosphere is really cool. The snack bar in the room is a nice touch. The rooms are very nice and larger than I would think for a boutique hotel. The bartenders were very courteous. You can't beat the location. You can walk to the Power and Light District and all it has to offer. The area is also nice enough to run outside.
reviews.title: nice nice nice

reviews.text: Cons - The ventilation in the room was weird. Everything was very dry and really messed up my sinuses. That led to not a very good sleep experience. The air in my room would not stay on unless I kept the fan on all the time. The fan was extremely loud, also making it hard to sleep.
reviews.title: Unexpected and Delightful Experience

reviews.text: I ordered breakfast room service one morning. My order was wrong the first time so I called room service and sent it back. They brought another order up, which was wrong again. The third time they got it right, but they still charged me the standard gratuity and didn't seem too concerned. The food was cold when I finally got to eat it. Its really frustrating to have gratuity tacked on to your bill when it obviously didn't deserve the 15%-20% (I don't remember exactly) that they add automatically.
reviews.title: Best in KC
Unexpected Find
reviews.text: I didn't have much interaction with the front desk, but the lady who checked me out after my stay was exceptionally friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the ambassador for our anniversary. We live in KC but wanted to get away downtown for a night.
reviews.title: Anniversary weekend stay ~ Big disappointment..

reviews.text: I called ahead and reserved a corner king room and let them know we would be on our anniversary. When we checked in, they didn't remember this at all. They didn't say happy anniversary, nothing special prepared, etc. This isn't the reason for the poor review, but it would have been nice. We ate at the Bristol at P&L... they had a card on the table and gave us preferential seating and free dessert. Not required, but appreciated and I will be a repeat customer. I wish the Ambassador understood this concept.
reviews.title: Classy, Quiet Historical Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: The reason for a poor review is the uncleanliness of the room. It is nicely decorated but was dirty. The counter was dirty. There was long hair on the sheets on the bed. There was hair on the counter in the bathroom. The mirror was dirty. I went to pull out the robes and they had long hair and big stain around the neck. One towel in the bathroom was not folded it was just sitting on the floor dirty. Gross. I went to take a shower the night we stayed and there was hair on the tile floor and a huge gunk of hair and dirt stuck over the floor drain. I cleaned it up before my wife had to see it. The bed was comfy and the air worked. Room is very loud though and music coming from lounge downstairs was loud on a saturday night.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.text: I did go down and try to get new robes, but the front desk girl was on her cell phone and I couldn't get her attention :( This isn't a pricey place compared to hotels I've stayed at in Chicago, NYC, etc... but its Kansas City. If people are asked to pay 250+ here the cleanliness, the staff, the service has to be all there.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.text: The sent me a followup email to see how my stay was. I told them the problems I had. No reply.
reviews.title: This hotel was a perfect fit for me!

description: The former Gate City National Bank building has been transformed into a chic, independent boutique hotel. Built in 1920, the seven-story structure exhibits the neoclassical style favored at the time. The building retains the striking architecture that put it on the National Register of Historic Places. Lobby walls and curved staircase to the lower level are sheathed in marble and Reserve Restaurant provides innovative cuisine.
